value.title: Build more effective conversations on Amazon Lex with confidence scores and increased accuracy
value.excerpt: In the rush of our daily lives, we often have conversations that contain ambiguous or incomplete sentences. For example, when talking to a banking associate, a customer might say, “What’s my balance?” This request is ambiguous and it is difficult to disambiguate if the intent of the customer is to check

value.title: Researchers discover evidence of gender bias in major computer vision APIs
value.excerpt: Researchers at Wunderman Thompson say they've found evidence of gender bias in major computer vision APIs from Google, IBM, and Microsoft.

value.title: AI and machine learning facilitate pioneering research on Parkinson's
value.excerpt: At Friday's 2020 Machine Learning for Healthcare Conference, IBM and Michael J. Fox Foundation reveal disease progression model that accurately pinpoints how far a patient's PD has advanced.

value.title: Researchers say ‘The Whiteness of AI’ in pop culture erases people of color
value.excerpt: Researchers argue predominately portraying artificial intelligence as white in science fiction, stock imagery, and popular culture has consequences.

value.title: The ‘Tesla Of Banking’ Start-Up Cred.ai Unveils Its AI-Powered Credit Card
value.excerpt: How many bonus features does it take to convince a millennial to use a credit card? Try no fees, no interest, credit optimization, self-destructing account numbers, spending on future paychecks, customizable settings,

value.title: Macy’s Sued Over Use of Clearview Facial-Recognition Software
value.excerpt: Macy’s Retail Holdings Inc. was targeted in one of the first lawsuits against users of the controversial facial-recognition software made by startup Clearview AI.

value.title: Google adds Digital Ink Recognition API for touch and stylus input to ML Kit
value.excerpt: Google introduced a new API for touch and stylus input to ML Kit, its machine learning development toolkit for Android and iOS.

value.title: Google's new voice and audio settings give you more control over your privacy
value.excerpt: Google on Wednesday let people know it's still having humans review voice and audio recordings on devices like Google Home. However, the search giant's email also said it's giving you more control over what's being shared and has automatically turned off the feature for all accounts.

value.title: City of Tucson Water Department Selects VODA.ai's Machine Learning to Support Decision-Making
value.excerpt: The City of Tucson Water Department has selected VODA.ai as their exclusive provider of artificial intelligence software service for pipe prioritization. value.title: Salesforce open-sources the AI Economist, a research environment for exploring tax policies
value.excerpt: Salesforce today open sourced the AI Economist, a research environment that leverages AI to arrive at optimal tax policies.

value.title: Apple explains how it uses machine learning across iOS—and soon, macOS

value.title: Why Elon Musk is wrong about Level 5 self-driving cars
value.excerpt: I’m extremely confident that level 5 [self-driving cars] or essentially complete autonomy will happen, and I think it will happen very quickly,” Tesla CEO Elon Musk said in a video message to the World Artificial Intelligence Conference in Shanghai earlier this month.

value.title: Google: Here's how much we give to open source through our GitHub activity
value.excerpt: Google has given an update on its contributions to open-source software, revealing that its employees were active in over 70,000 repositories on GitHub in 2019.  Google's new 'by the numbers' snapshot of its contributions to open source over the past five years to 2019 shows its growing activity on Microsoft-owned Git-based code-hosting site GitHub,

value.title: Is the carbon footprint of AI too big?

value.title: Infermedica scores $10M Series A for its ‘AI-driven’ diagnosis and triage platform
value.excerpt: Infermedica, the Poland-founded health tech startup that offers an AI-driven platform for preliminary diagnosis and triage, has raised just over $10 million in Series A funding. The round is led by the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) and digital health fund Heal Capital.

value.title: AI models need to be ‘interpretable’ rather than just ‘explainable’
value.excerpt: Apple ran into trouble after customers pointed out on Twitter that its credit card service was discriminating against women. David Heinemeir Hansson, the creator of Ruby on Rails, called Apple Card a sexist program.

value.title: Black Hat: Hackers can remotely hijack enterprise, healthcare Temi robots
value.excerpt: Robots used in hospitals and care homes to assist patients and the vulnerable can be fully hijacked by cyberattackers.  On Thursday at Black Hat USA, McAfee's Advanced Threat Research (ATR) team disclosed new research into the robots,

value.title: AI named after V For Vendetta masks protects photos from being gathered by facial recognition apps
value.excerpt: A new AI-powered program 'cloaks' images to ward off facial recognition apps. The tool makes subtle pixel-level changes that distort pictures enough so they cannot be used by online scrapers.

value.title: Researchers say we need better benchmarks to build more useful AI assistants
value.excerpt: AI researchers from Element AI, Stanford University, and CIFAR recommend more useful forms of AI that speak with people to get things done.

value.title: Researchers propose AI that delivers personalized health recommendations via smartphone
value.excerpt: Researchers at Harvard, Stanford, and the University of Michigan propose an AI system that delivers personalized health recommendations via mobile.

value.title: Is Facebook Doing Enough To Stop Racial Bias In AI?
value.excerpt: After recently announcing Equity and Inclusion teams to investigate racial bias across their platforms, and undergoing a global advertising boycott over alleged racial discrimination, is Facebook doing enough to tackle racial bias?

value.title: Evil AI: These are the 20 most dangerous crimes that artificial intelligence will create
value.excerpt: From targeted phishing campaigns to new stalking methods: there are plenty of ways that artificial intelligence could be used to cause harm if it fell into the wrong hands. value.title: Expert System raises $29.4 million for AI text extraction and analysis
value.excerpt: Expert System has raised $29.4 million to bolster the development of its natural language processing technologies for enterprise customers.
